title: Design Studies and Material Culture: Practical Understanding Through Interdisciplinary Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of design and cultural studies concepts, with foundational math analysis skills
context.additional_context: Course for working professionals exploring symbolic meanings of material culture and design roles through real-life case analyses linked to work environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the social impact of design and usage behaviors by analyzing the physical and cultural contexts of everyday objects
Learners can apply mathematical modeling techniques to evaluate the symbolic value of material culture through an interdisciplinary approach
Learners can design team-based design projects using smartphone-based collaboration tools and present prototypes reflecting cultural implications as final deliverables

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
